ABILITY.NAME: Name
ABILITYREF.DIALOG: This will allow you to use integrated rolls for this specific ability. If it's a homebrew ability or if you do not want to use the scripts, select "No reference". Warning : you won't be able to reference after that, if you want to you'll have to create a new ability.
ABILITY_BERSERKER.CHAT_DEACTIVATE: {actorname} calms down and quits berserker rage.
ABILITY_BERSERKER.CHAT_RESULT_LVL1: Melee damage increased, base defense set to 5.
ABILITY_BERSERKER.CHAT_RESULT_LVL2: Melee damage increased, armor bonus, base defense set to 5.
ABILITY_MEDICUS.DIALOG: Will you use an herbal cure?
ABILITY_MEDICUS.NO_TARGET: No target, medicus roll without healing
ABILITY_WITCHSIGHT.CHAT_FINAL: The color of the shadow of {targetname} is: {targetshadow}
ARMOR.NAME: Name
ARTIFACT.NAME: Name
ARTIFACT.TITLE: ARTIFACT POWERS
BIO.NAME: Name
BOON.NAME: Name
BURDEN.NAME: Name
CHAT.GMTEXT_BUTTON: This button is for GM use only. It will apply the results on the characters.
CHAT.GM_INFO_RESIST: must click on the "resist" button in the chat log for rolling resistance against the attack.
COMBAT.CHAT_BLEED: bleeds and loses toughness each round:
COMBAT.CHAT_POISON_EXTEND: Target was already poisoned, new duration: rounds:
COMBAT.CHAT_FLAMING_SUCCESS1: is burning. Starting next round, damage will be :
COMBAT.CHAT_JOINTED_SECONDARY: Defence succeeds, but the jointed weapon hits anyway (see jointed quality for evaluating damage).
COMBAT.DEFENSE_ROLL: tries to defend against the attack.
CORRUPTION.CHAT_WARNING: is close to a corruption treshold.
DIALOG.FEAT_STRENGTH_DAMAGE: Bonus damage from Feat of Strength
EQUIPMENT.NAME: Name
ERROR.MACRO_NOT_OWNED: You can only create macro buttons for owned Items.
ERROR.MACRO_NO_OBJECT: The selected token character does not have an item named :
INITIATIVE.TITLE: Initiative
MACRO.ADDEXP_NUMBER: Need a valid number of experience, either positive or negative
MACRO.ADDEXP_CHANGE_LONG:
The following actors:
    {actorNames}
were awarded {exp} experience
MACRO.ROLLATTRIBUTE_NOACTOR: No actor available for you to do an attribute test
MYSTICAL_POWER.NAME: Name
POWER_BENDWILL.CHAT_INTRO: {actorname} try to bend the victim's will.
POWER_BLACKBOLT.CHAT_INTRO: {actorname} traps its target in black fire.
POWER_BLESSEDSHIELD.CHAT_SUCCESS: {actorname} is surrounded by a shield of light.
POWER_CONFUSION.EFFECT34: {targetname} attacks whichever of its allies is closest.
POWER_CONFUSION.EFFECT56: {targetname} attacks whichever of its enemies is closest.
POWER_CURSE.CHAT_SUCCESS_M: {targetname} is heavily cursed (1d6 damage for each action).
POWER_CURSE.CHAT_FAIL_FINAL: The curse has no more effect on {targetname}.
POWER_DANCINGWEAPON.CHAT_RESULT_ACTIVATE: Combat stats are replaced by Resolute.
POWER_ENTANGLINGVINES.CHAT_INTRO_M: {targetname} tries to break free from the vines.
POWER_HOLYAURA.CHAT_INTRO: {actorname} tries to channel the Light of Prios.
POWER_HOLYAURA.CHAT_FAILURE: {actorname} can't channel the light of Prios.
POWER_INHERITWOUND.CHAT_REDIRECT: ; poison and bleeding are also transfered.
POWER_LARVAEBOILS.CHAT_SUCCESS: {targetname} is eaten from the inside by the larvaes.
POWER_PRIOSBURNINGGLASS.CHAT_INTRO: {actorname} tries to channel the Light of Prios at a target.
POWER_TORMENTINGSPIRITS.CHAT_INTRO_M: {actorname} tries to maintain the tormenting spirits.
POWER_WITCHHAMMER.CHAT_RESULT: Witch hammer bonus damage will be available in combat dialog window.
TOOLTIP.EXPERIENCE_TOTAL: The total amount of experience that you earnt
TOOLTIP.EXPERIENCE_ARTIFACTRR: Experience spent on artifacts and/or re-rolls
TOOLTIP.EXPERIENCE_SPENT: Total experience spent on abilities, traits, boons and burdens
TOOLTIP.HEALTH.CORRUPTION_LONGTERM: Your corruption that lasts longer than a scene
TOOLTIP.HEALTH.TOUGHNESS_TOTAL: The amount of toughness damage that will cause you to die
TOOLTIP.COMBAT.INITIATIVE: The attribute that your initiative is based on
TOOLTIP.COMBAT.DEFENSE: The attribute that your defense is based on
TOOLTIP.POWER_ACTIONS: Type of activation (A - active, P - passive, S - special, etc)
TOOLTIP.DIALOG.HASSCRIPT: Can be clicked on the icon or right click and select USE to roll
TRAIT.NAME: Name
WEAPON.NAME: Name
WEAPON_CLASS.LABEL: Weapon type
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_CRIT_HINT: Check to enable Hit bonus and Defense fumbles on dice rolls of 1 and 20 as detailed Core Book p. 179
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_ALWAYSSUCCEDONONE: Always able to succeed of fail
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_ALWAYSSUCCEDONONE_HIN: Check to always succeed on a 1 and fail on a 20
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_RARECRIT_HINT: Check to enable rarer critical rolls as detailed Core Book p. 179
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_ALWAYSUSECRIT_HINT: Check to enable critical success and failure on non-combat rolls - automatically enabled if crits are selected
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_MORERITUALS_HINT: Check to enable more rituals as described on Advanced Players Guide p. 103
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_AUTOCOMBAT_HINT: Check to enable QoL enhancement for smooth combat. Read the Symbaroum system guide for FoundryVTT in the compendium section for more info
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_SAVECOMBATROLL_HINT: Check to enable QoL enhancement for keeping all modifiers when rolling combat (weapon/defense)
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_SAVEATTRIBUTEROLL_HIN: Check to enable QoL enhancement for keeping all modifiers when rolling attribute tests
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_SHOWMODIFIERSINDIALOG: Show modifers in targetted attribute rolls
Check to enable QoL enhancement for showing attribute modifiers before making the roll
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_NPC_MODIFIERS_HINT: Check to show NPC modifiers (-5 to +5) instead of attributes for NPCs on character sheet
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_INIATITIVEROLLS_HINT: Check to QoL disabling of Initiative rolls in chat
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_AUTOROLLINITIATIVE: Automatically roll initiative at start of combat
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_AUTOROLLINITIATIVE_HI: Check to enable automatic initiative at start of combat
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_SHOWREFERENCE_HINT: Warning - GM Only - allow to manually adjust reference implementation for abilities, traits and mystical powers. Requires refresh.
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_INIT_MANUAL_HINT: Check to de-active the automated evaluation of the attribute used for initiative.
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_RESET_NOTE: NOTE: Submit and Reset will cause FVTT to reload.
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_CONFIG_MENUHINT: Configure PC and NPC sheet background color (These are Client based settings).
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_ADD_MENUHINT: Add Colour setting button to Main Config panel.
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_PLAYER_RESIST_HINT: When NPCs use powers that can be resisted, or attack with Combat Enhancement options, instead of rolling directly this option creates a button in the relevant player Chat that the Player will have to click on for the resist roll to be done.
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_NPC_ATTACKS: Show multiple attacks in the weapon box for NPCs
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_NPC_ATTACKS_HINT: Warning: the system tries it best to process this, but can't integrate some traits / abilities that are situationnal or complex.
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_ENHANCEDDEATHSAVEBONU: Death save bonus applies for crit
Any death save bonus applies to the odds of critical success, i.e. either improve or remove chance of critical success of death saves
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_ALLROLLSDICESONICE: Dice so Nice module on all rolls
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_ALLROLLSDICESONICE_HI: When the Dice so Nice module is added and Enhanced Combat option is enabled, a lot of dice can be thrown at the same time on the screen. By default, only the base d20 action roll will be displayed. Check this option if you prefer to have all dice displayed (damage, poison, etc).
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_SHOWLOCALLANGPACK_HIN: Will only show language compendium that matches your chosen language and the english macro & system compendium
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_SHOWENGLISHPACKS: Include all english compendium with the chosen language
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_SHOWENGLISHPACKS_HINT: In addition to your chosen language, it will also show all english compendiums
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_HIDEENGLISHMACROS: Exclude English macro and system compendium
SYMBAROUM.OPTIONAL_HIDEENGLISHMACROS_HIN: Exclude the English system and macro compendiums, which are shown otherwise
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_SETTINGS_CONTENT: To get to the Symbaroum configuration, click the 'Game Settings' icon
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_CONFIGURE_CONTENT: Select the 'Configure Settings' for the settings for Foundry, Symbaroum and all modules
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_SYSSETTINGS_CONTEN: To see the Symbaroum specific settings, select Symbaroum in the panel
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_SYMBSETTINGS_CONTE: The 'Configure Symbaroum settings' allows tailoring of colours and background images used in the system
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_SYMBSETTINGS_GS_CO: The 'Configure Symbaroum settings' is also available directly under the 'Game Settings'
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_SYMBSETTINGS_EC_CO: Enhanced combat, nicknamed EC, can be turned on here for combat automation
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_SYMBSETTINGS_ALL_C: There are quite a few settings for Symbaroum that might have a better fit at your table
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_SYSGUIDE_JOURNALS_: For further information and details, go to 'Journals'
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CONFIG_SYSGUIDE_DOC_CONTE: The Symbaroum System guide comes automatically with the system and is recommended reading
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_COMPENDIUMS: As default a new world starts empty
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_COMPENDIUMS_CONTENT: However, with Free Leagues permission, we can help you fill it
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_ADVENTURECOMPENDIUM_CONTE: The Symbaroum adventure compendium contains all that you need to get started
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_ADVENTURECOMPENDIUM_HIGHL: Clicking on an adventure will allow you to import content into your world
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_ACTOR_ERROR: For a player to complete this, the GM needs to run through the GM tour and not delete 'Beremo' in the actor catalogue
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_ACTORTAB_CONTEN: Under the actor tab, you find all actors (players/npc) that you or module have created for you
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_ACTORTAB_CREATE: The create actor button will prompt for name (mandatory) and type (player/npc). Lets create an actor for you.
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_SELECTACTOR_CON: We created the character Beremo for you. When its name is clicked, it will open up the character sheet
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_HEADER_CONTENT: The header contains information such as name, xp (see more in system guide), race and more
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_TABS_CONTENT: These are the different sections for the character sheet - we will come back to these
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_ATTRIBUTES_CONT: This is the list of attributes for this character
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_ATTRIBUTES_ACCU: This is the value of characters accurate, note the field is read-only (indicated by the blue-ish background)
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_ATTRIBUTES_CONF: To change attribute values, click on this cog-wheel. Normally you just change the Base value. The mod value is reserved for alternate damage
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_COMBAT_ARMOR_CO:
This is the quick link for active armor. Clicking on the this will roll defense.
Note that when using enhanced combat then this button does not do anything
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_COMBAT_WEAPON_C: This is the quick link for active weapon(s).  Clicking on these will try to use the weapon in combat.
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_COMBAT_ABILITIE: This contains the list of abilities, traits, powers, rituals, boons and burdens the character have. The exp for these are automatically totalled in the exp field
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_GEAR_CONTENT: The GEAR tab is where you can make modifications to your equipment, such as wear it or rename it
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_GEAR_ARMOR_CONT: This is the armor owned by the character, be it active, equipped or just owned
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_GEAR_ARMOR_EQUI: Gear have three states, active (being used), equipped (being worn) or other (stashed/owned but not here). Only Active gear appear on the first tab (MAIN)
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_GEAR_ARMOR_NAME: This is the name of the armor, clicking on this will open the armors configuration screen for this character
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_BIO_CONTENT: This contains the bio of the character.
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_BIO_SHADOW_CONT: For example, here is the characters shadow
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_NOTES_CONTENT: This tab is here so that the character can keep notes and other information
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_NOTES_FIELD_CON:
This is where the character can write details - to activate click on the top right icon that appears when moving the mouse here.
This wraps up this tour, we will leave the character so that players can run through this tour
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_CHARACTER_OVERVIEW_CONTEN: Good luck, and please check the System guide for more information
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_ACOMPENDIUM_GOTOCONTENT: You will find the Symbaroum system adventure compendium under the compendium tab
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_ACOMPENDIUM_SYSTEM_CONTEN: The Symbaroum system compendium can be opened here
SYMBAROUM.TOUR_ACOMPENDIUM_SYSTEM_ENGLIS: There are many compendiums here with translated content. If you import them, pick the one for your language
This is the English compendium and information about it
This is items that this compendium contains and will move into your world
You click here to start the import - be patient and allow it to complete before running another one
